body_html:
@tiger2017 not really.
The difference is that torch tensors are mutable, while python numbers are immutable.
You can try the same using python lists (which are mutable) or numpy arrays (which are mutable as well).

a = 1
print(id(a))  # something
a += 1
print(id(a))  # has changed!

Have a look at https://stackoverflow.com/questions/8056130/immutable-vs-mutable-types for more information about mutable / immutable types in python.

body:
@tiger2017 not really.
The difference is that torch tensors are mutable, while python numbers are immutable.
You can try the same using python lists (which are mutable) or numpy arrays (which are mutable as well).
```python
a = 1
print(id(a))  # something
a += 1
print(id(a))  # has changed!
```

Have a look at https://stackoverflow.com/questions/8056130/immutable-vs-mutable-types for more information about mutable / immutable types in python.
